## VariableModel.(constructor)

Constructs a new instance of the `VariableModel` class

**Signature:**

```typescript
constructor(workspace: Workspace, name: string, opt_type?: string, opt_id?: string);
```

<tr><td>

name


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The name of the variable. This is the user-visible name (e.g. 'my var' or '私の変数'), not the generated name.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

opt\_type


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The type of the variable like 'int' or 'string'. Does not need to be unique. Field\_variable can filter variables based on their type. This will default to '' which is a specific type.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

opt\_id


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The unique ID of the variable. This will default to a UUID.


</td></tr>
